Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2009 05:16PM vlday wrote: Hi All:  I started in the August thread, thinking that I would start chemo a little earlier, but that didn't happen.  I had my surgery July 2nd, small tumor, and had a lumpectomy on my right breast.  Nodes were clear.  Anyway, did the oncotype dx test, very expensive, but I kind of knew that I would need chemo since the cancer was a grade 3.  So, with all the time, and drs. vacations, I put my treatment into September.  I also made a choice to take a leave of absence from my job as an elementary principal and not stress my body out.  (Very stressful job)  This way, I can focus on treatments and recovery.  My port goes in on August 31st and first treatment is on Sept. 2nd.  My friend lent me her Wii so I am working out on that to keep fit and well as walking and being outside before the weather changes.  I will have 4x A/C (Adriamycin and Cytoxan) then 4x taxoral (sp?).  That hopefully will get me into December, then radiation.  I have all the anti nasuea meds to go along with my cocktail.  Got my skull caps in too and then have to order some wigs because I know the hair is going.  That is not what is scaring me as much as the nausea/vomiting and fatigue and stress.  I am getting a MUGA scan on Wed, making sure that my heart (if I have one) is good before going through this treatment. Tammy, hang in there.  I am scared as hell too, but I know we'll get through it.  The port will be worth it as it will not tax your arms and veins.  Okay, thinking of you all and will post once I get started.  Hang in there you all.  Hey, did we should come up with a name for our month, don't ya think.  Who's creative out there?  Vicki
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa
